transportAdvice: Tamuning and the broader tourist corridor along Tumon Bay are walkable within the resort strip, but distances between attractions across the island require a vehicle. Public bus service exists but has limited coverage and infrequent schedules, so most visitors rely on rental cars or taxis for flexibility.

weather.description: Dry season is underway with warm temperatures and occasional brief showers, generally pleasant for beach activities.
One of the driest and sunniest months of the year, ideal for outdoor and water activities.
Warm and mostly dry with plenty of sunshine, excellent conditions for snorkeling and beach visits.
Temperatures begin to climb and conditions remain dry, making it a popular time for visitors.
Heat and humidity increase noticeably as the wet season approaches, with occasional afternoon showers.
Wet season begins with frequent rain and high humidity, though showers are often short-lived.
Peak of the wet season with heavy rainfall and elevated typhoon risk; outdoor plans may need flexibility.
Continued heavy rain and the highest typhoon risk of the year; travelers should monitor weather closely.
Typhoon season remains active with frequent downpours and oppressive humidity throughout the month.
Rain begins to ease slightly toward month's end but conditions remain wet and humid overall.
Transition toward the dry season with decreasing rainfall and gradually more comfortable conditions.
Dry season returns with warm temperatures and a mix of sunny days and occasional showers.
